dissect:
解剖 
to cut open something, especially a dead body or a plant, and study its structure

仔细分析 
to examine or consider something in detail 
172
ferment:
骚动，动乱 
a situation in which there is much excitement and confusion caused by change

发酵 
to go through a chemical change that results in the production of alcohol
conscientious:
道德的，良心的 
governed by, or made or done according to, what one knows is right; scrupulous; honest
aesthetic:
审美的；有审美观点的；美学的 
concerned with beauty and art and the understanding of beautiful things

美的；艺术的 
made in an artistic way and beautiful to look at
conspiracy:
合谋，共谋 
a secret plan made by two or more people to do something that is harmful or illegal
overlap:
重叠，重合 
to lie over the edge of (something); to cover part of the edge of (something)
rationale:
基本原理；根本原因 
the principles or reasons which explain a particular decision, course of action, belief, etc.
retrospect:
回想，回顾 
a survey or review of a past course of events or period of time
mar:
污点；瑕疵 
something that mars; blemish

破坏 
to ruin the beauty or perfection of (something); to hurt or damage the good condition of (something)
in_tandem_with:
与 同时发生 ，与 协作；配合 
a thing that works or happens in tandem with something else works together with it or 
happens at the same time as it
omnipotent:
无所不能的 
having complete or unlimited power; all-powerful
gale:
大风；飓风 
an extremely strong wind

一阵大笑声 
the sound of very loud laughter
cater:
为社交活动提供饮食，承办酒席 
to provide food and drinks for a social event 
173
initiate:
使初步了解，传授 
to teach (someone) the basic facts or ideas about something

使开始 
to cause the beginning of (something); to start or begin (something)
dedicate:
献 身 ，投 身 ，致力 
to decide that (something) will be used for (a special purpose); to use (time, money, 
energy, attention, etc.) for (something)
reticent:
沉默的 
not willing to tell people about things
covet:
垂涎，觊觎 
to want (something that you do not have) very much
jumble:
杂物 
a group of things that are not arranged in a neat or orderly way

使混乱 
to cause (things) to be mixed together in a way that is not neat or orderly
clasp:
紧握 
to fasten (something) with a clasp

抱紧 
to hold (someone or something) tightly with your hands or arms
demur:
表示反对；提出异议；拒绝 
to say that you do not agree with something or that you refuse to do something
bout:
一阵；一场； 尤指坏事的一通，一次 
a short period of great activity; a short period during which there is a lot of a particular 
thing, usually something unpleasant

疾病的发作；发病期 
an attack or period of illness

拳击或摔跤比赛 
a boxing or wrestling match
watershed:
分水岭 
a line of hills or mountains from which rivers drain; a ridge between two rivers

转折点 
a time when an important change happens
tyrant:
僭主暴君 
a cruel and oppressive ruler
disfranchise:
剥夺…的权利，剥夺…的选举权，剥夺…公民权 
to deprive someone of some privilege, especially the right to vote; to disenfranchise 
174
grope:
摸索；搜索；搜寻；探寻 
to try and find something that you cannot see, by feeling with your hands

猥亵；摸 某人 
to touch somebody sexually, especially when they do not want you to

猥亵；摸 
an act of groping somebody
wary:
机警的，谨慎的 
not having or showing complete trust in someone or something that could be dangerous or 
cause trouble
indigenous:
土生土长的，本土的 
produced, living, or existing naturally in a particular region or environment
prodigious:
巨大的；庞大的；大得惊人的 
very large or powerful and causing surprise or admiration
deteriorate:
恶化 
to become worse as time passes
elusive:
难以得到的，难以描述的；想不起来的；难以实现的 
difficult to find, describe, remember, or achieve
designate:
指派 
to officially choose (someone or something) to do or be something
saline:
盐的；含盐的；咸的 
containing salt
abyssal:
深渊的；深不可测的；深海的 
resembling an abyss in depth; so deep as to be unmeasurable; relating to the bottom of the 
ocean, especially to depths of between 3 000 and 6 000 metres
alimony:
离婚后一方给另一方的赡养费，生活费，扶养费 
the money that a court of law orders somebody to pay regularly to their former wife or

exemplary:
堪称典范的 
extremely good and deserving to be admired and copied
kinship:

亲属关系

野蛮人的，未开化的 
of or relating to a land, culture, or people alien and usually believed to be inferior to

野蛮人

fetter:

to put chains around someone's feet to prevent motion

脚镣 
a chain or manacle used to restrain a prisoner, typically placed around the ankles
purport:
主旨，意图 
the main or general meaning of something (such as a speech or a person's actions)

声称，主张 
to claim to be or do a particular thing when this claim may not be true
fertile:
肥沃的，富饶的 
producing or bearing many crops in great quantities
aristocrat:

a member of an aristocracy
subsidy:

bondage:

proliferate:

perplex:

to confuse (someone) very much
dismal:
忧郁的 
showing or causing unhappiness or sad feelings; not warm, cheerful, etc.
orthodox:
正统的，传统的 
accepted as true or correct by most people; supporting or believing what most people think

thrive:
兴旺发达；繁荣；蓬勃发展；旺盛；茁壮成长 
to become, and continue to be, successful, strong, healthy, etc.
ramification:
决定、计划、事件产生的后果，影响 
something that is the result of an action, decision, etc.
interbreed:
使 杂交繁殖 
(with reference to an animal) to breed or cause to breed with another of a different race or species
drench:
使湿透 
to make (someone or something) completely wet
be_taken_aback:
被 吓了一跳；大吃一惊；震惊 
to be shocked or surprised by somebody/something
proposition:
议题；建议；提案 
something (such as a plan or offer) that is presented to a person or group of people to consider
introvert:
内向的人 
a shy person; a quiet person who does not find it easy to talk to other people
flinch:
突然 退缩；畏缩

177
abject:
凄惨的，糟透的，蹩脚的

very humble; feeling or showing shame; lacking courage or strength
undergo:
经历，忍受 
to experience or endure (something)
sidestep:
避免 
to avoid walking into or being hit by (someone or something) by stepping to the right or left
stalemate:
僵局 
a contest, dispute, competition, etc., in which neither side can gain an advantage or win

accomplice:
共犯，同谋，帮凶 
a person who works with or helps someone who is doing something wrong or illegal
precursor:
先兆，前兆

先驱，前辈

swap:

to give something to someone and receive something in return; to trade or exchange (things)
prototype:
原型；标准 
an original or first model of something from which other forms are copied or developed
blot:
污点；墨渍

做出有损形象的事；玷污名誉 
to do something to spoil the opinion that other people have of you
deceitful:
欺骗的

brag:
吹嘘

perilous:
危险的；艰险的

受欺压的；被蹂躏的；被践踏的

conceited:
自负的，自高自大的 
having or showing too much pride in your own worth or goodness
twilight:
黄昏 
the period when day is ending and night is beginning
forage:
觅食

搜索

饲料，草料 
bulky food such as grass or hay for horses and cattle; fodder
plump:
丰满的；胖乎乎的；圆滚滚的

ridicule:
嘲笑

ratification:

inevitable:
不可避免的
